Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2011 05:40PM dorothym wrote: I am 5 months PFC and have almost 3".  It is silver/gray and curly.  I have no style.  Very frustrating but I'm happy its not bald!
Posts.Title: NOW I'm vain about my hair. anonymice anonymice

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 12:20PM dorothym wrote: ISLANDMOM:  My doctor initially recommended TAC back when I started (9/1/10), and doing the six rounds.  Its a tough road but it is effective.  I did have 2 nodes with micro mets (didn't even show up on the pet scan).  Because of an adriamycin shortage, we had to switch to FEC (which in my opinion was horrible as compared to the TAC).  Just remember- you are insuring against future recurrence!  I wish you the best of luck and in a few months it will be over.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 06:10PM dorothym wrote: By day 17 I was bald.  It was dead the day after the first chemo treatment.  Wouldn't blow, style - nothing - just hung.  By day 13 it was breaking off.  On day 14 I had it buzzed to about 1/2".  3 days later - I had 10 hairs on my head, none of which touched.   I was on TAC.  I had a g/f who went through chemo.  Had lush, wavy long hair and didn't lose a strand!  It depends on the cocktail you get.
Posts.Title: Million Dollar Question on Hair Loss! Rockym nicholewilliams

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2011 09:46AM dorothym wrote: Christine47:  I started on TAC - and yes the 3rd round SUCKED.  Then  there was the Adriamycin shortage, so my Dr. switched me to FEC.  That was even worse.  I was soo sick.  After that, he calculated that I had the same amount of AC as if I had chosen 4 AC plus 12 Taxol.  He switched me to 6 more weeks of Taxol which was so much easier to handle.  And my hair started growing back.  I finished treatment on 1/6/11 and just pray this is the end of it.  Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: TAC, anyone stop early? christine47 Luan

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 10:23AM dorothym wrote: Christine47:  that shortage was back in November, 10 (seems like another life ago right now).  Hair was very big for me also - I cried ALOT and OFTEN.  Today I took my son to Supercuts for a haircut and I almost lost it there.  My hair is still very short - about 1.25-1.5 inches.   However, it is thick.  I look like I have a bad boys cut.  I generally do not go to many places without my scarf on.  At work I'm ok in my office, but not around strangers.  I wear alot of make up so everyone knows i'm really a woman.  My eyelashes are falling out for the 2nd time but after the first time they grew in thick.  I'm waiting for them to all come in again.  I have lots of new tubes of mascara.
Posts.Title: TAC, anyone stop early? christine47 Luan

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2010 07:07AM dorothym wrote: I am also terrified at the prospect of starting chemo.  Had double mast on 7/1.  2 lymph nodes had traces of c cells.  I'm making myself sick over this
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 01:26PM dorothym wrote: I started chemo on 9/1/10 and I finished my last taxol on 1/6.  Had a problem with my left tissue expander (and that was the non cancer side) and it was removed on 2/1.  But I'm feeling so much better!!  I'm doing "normal" things again.  I need to start taking my Arimidex but keep putting it off.  My first set of blood work for cancer markers was normal.  Looking forward to getting my implants on 4/15.  Hair is coming in thick but still not long enough to do anything with.  I'm so glad we all crawled out of that tunnel!
Posts.Title: Sept Sisters-recovering from chemo Scrabblelady ToriGirl

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 11:25AM dorothym wrote: I did TAC.  Luckily everyone has a different experience and I hope yours is not bad.  The first tx I had was on Wed and by Sat I felt like I was run over by a truck.  I was in bed Sat and Sun and felt better on Monday, went to work on Tues.  With each successive treatment the "sick" lasted longer.  Also, the tiredness between treatments became much more invasive.  I could not eat for days after treatments.  I would fluctuate between constipation and diarrhea.  My taste changed and many foods that I normally ate were totally unappealing.  Acutally, I fell in love with with bread and butter and cup of soup.  (Now I look at that red box and want to stab it with a big kitchen knife).  My skin became so dry it peeled (especially over my tissue expanders).   Losing hair on day 13 was horrible.  The txs triggered asthma attacks for me.  But the bright side is that you will come out of this healthy!!!!  I'm now 6 weeks post chemo and while not myself, feeling better every week.  My hair is almost an inch long.  My eyelashes are growing back.  I can wear make up again.  Sometimes I even laugh again.  You will also.  To help me get through I made a pink construction paper garland, with a link for each day until the end of the last three week treatment period.  I had a bag and each day I pulled off a link.  When my hair gets long enough to get rid of the scarves, hats and wigs, I'm having a Pink Ribbon bra burning party.  All the old bras, various pieces of memorabilia like hospital bands, a copy of each report, the mammo films, etc. are all going in the fire.  I can't wait.  Good luck to you and keep the end goal in mind - as hard as it may be.  God Bless.
Posts.Title: TAC X6 ?? Thundershowers Leslie1010

Posts.Content: May 13, 2011 08:12PM dorothym wrote: I had 3 TAC, one FEC and 6 Taxol.  I was bald by day 15 of the first TAC.  My hair started growing back three weeks after the last FEC.  At first my scalp was sore for a few days, and then the hairs starting sprouting.  I finished chemo on 1/6 and have about 2.5 inches of curly hair.
Posts.Title: hair growth after chemotherapy abcd dorothym

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2011 09:49PM dorothym wrote: I'm on Letrozole which is Femara - the generic.  I have alot of shortness of breath, some aches, very broken sleep and HORRIBLE hot flashes.  Also I noticed an increase in body temp.  My normal is 97.6.  I'm running about 99 now.  I wonder if the meds from another lab make a difference?  I'm going to check it out.
Posts.Title: Femara versus Letrozole jackwagstaff Azura

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 09:19PM dorothym wrote: Hey Sisters - its been months and we've crawled out of the tunnel.  I hope everyone is well.  Last Saturday, on 6/4, the one year anniversary of my dx, I had a party with about 25 of my girlfriends.  Had finger sandwiches, champagne punch and petit fours.  Then I threw all the pre BC bras in the barbeque, along with mammo films, reports, etc. and set them on fire.  It was a great party and a nice way to start the "new year".  I thought I would cry, but I didn't.  It was cathartic.  Still having some residual side effects, but life is getting better.  God Bless us all.  Dorothy
Posts.Title: Sept Sisters-recovering from chemo Scrabblelady ToriGirl
